translated: The section on the dyads, the section on the dyads on causes

original: Nasaraṇaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca araṇo hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Naaraṇaṁ🔽nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca saraṇo hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā
analyzed: na saraṇam na hetum dhammam paṭicca araṇaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā na araṇa  na hetum dhammam paṭicca saraṇaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā
translated: A non-conflict-originated, cause-dhamma arises conditioned by a non-conflict-originated, non-cause-dhamma by way of condition as cause. A conflict-originated, cause-dhamma arises conditioned by a non-conflict-originated, non-cause-dhamma by way of condition as cause. (Abbreviated.)

translated: In the dyads, there are two … in the septuple-dyads, there are two.🔽A non-conflict-originated, non-cause-dhamma arises conditioned by a non-conflict-originated, non-cause-dhamma by way of condition as cause.
